90000110. A Great Puja

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • State religion is hindu
  • Aristocracy is at 7 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Stability is at 3 or higher

Description

In Hinduism, the King's duty to his people was a very serious charge. To show the King's control over the state and to show piousness, the King might throw an expensive religious ceremony, a Royal Puja. These were thrown on auspicious days as advised by astrologers and holy men. To not hold such an event on a recomended day would be seen poorly.

Actions

A. It's too expensive

  • -5 victory points

B. Hold a Royal Puja

  • Stability +1
  • -50

Back to top

91000110. A Great Puja

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • State religion is hindu
  • Aristocracy is at 7 or higher
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Stability is at 3 or higher

Description

In Hinduism, the King's duty to his people was a very serious charge. To show the King's control over the state and to show piousness, the King might throw an expensive religious ceremony, a Royal Puja. These were thrown on auspicious days as advised by astrologers and holy men. To not hold such an event on a recomended day would be seen poorly.

Actions

A. It's too expensive

  • -10 victory points

B. Hold a Royal Puja

  • Stability +1
  • -100

Back to top

92000110. A Great Puja

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • State religion is hindu
  • Aristocracy is at 7 or higher
  • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Stability is at 3 or higher

Description

In Hinduism, the King's duty to his people was a very serious charge. To show the King's control over the state and to show piousness, the King might throw an expensive religious ceremony, a Royal Puja. These were thrown on auspicious days as advised by astrologers and holy men. To not hold such an event on a recomended day would be seen poorly.

Actions

A. Hold a Royal Puja

  • Stability +1
  • -100

B. It's too expensive

  • -25 victory points

Back to top

93000110. A Great Puja

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • State religion is hindu
  • Aristocracy is at 7 or higher
  • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 80 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Stability is at 3 or higher

Description

In Hinduism, the King's duty to his people was a very serious charge. To show the King's control over the state and to show piousness, the King might throw an expensive religious ceremony, a Royal Puja. These were thrown on auspicious days as advised by astrologers and holy men. To not hold such an event on a recomended day would be seen poorly.

Actions

A. Hold a Royal Puja

  • Stability +1
  • -250

B. It's too expensive

  • -50 victory points

91000024. Agricultural Revolution

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

New farming techniques plantations irrigation and land properties organization were soon translated into increased agricultural production and therefore higher tax income for the state. However countries with backward peasantry and conservative political structure were slower than others to put progress into effect.

Actions

A. OK

  • +1 base manpower in a random province

Back to top

90000048. Assassination of Noble

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Aristocracy is at 9 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Noble families were the bulwark of power during these times. Assassination of a powerful house leader was seen as a critical blow to those families' fortunes. With the rise of religious strife, assassinations of rival religion's nobles became increasingly common.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability -3
  • A random province revolts

Back to top

91000066. Boundary Dispute

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Stability is at 3 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

The lack of good maps or the tools to create accurate maps would occasionally lead to overlapping claims of authority in border regions. These disputes were usually over very marginal areas but could serve as a point of friction when monarchs decided to press the issue.

Actions

A. Press Issue

  • Stability -1
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against a random country for 6 months
  • -25 relations with the same country

B. Settle Issue

  • Stability +1
  • +40 relations with the same country
  • -50

Back to top

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:

  • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

  • Stability +1
  • +40 relations with a random country
  • -50

B. Press Issue

  • Stability -1
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against the same country for 6 months
  • -25 relations with the same country

96000059. Bourgeoisie Request Privileges

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Trade tech is at 2 or higher
  • Aristocracy is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Aristocracy is at 10 or higher

Description

The Bourgeoisie class grew increasing resentful of the power of the noble families and particularly their lack of opportunities in the higher ranks of government. One route into power was to marry into poor but well titled noble families. The other was to pry open positions in government circles.

Actions

A. Grant

  • Aristocracy -1

B. Deny

  • Aristocracy +1

Back to top

96000042. Buddha Performs Miracle

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is confucian
    • State religion is buddhist

Description

Some people were so devout in their religion that they set out to help the poor and heal the sick. They were often called buddhas for their acts and were sometimes even believed to perform miracles.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability +1
  • Global revolt risk -1 for 12 months

Back to top

92009062. Build a Great Palace

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Country is not at war
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Aristocracy is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Centralization is at 10 or higher
  • Infrastructure tech is at 1 or higher

Description

Monarchs struggles with ways to subdue the nobility. The rise of firearms reduced the nobles' role as warriors but left them with in the eyes of the monarchs too much idle time. Some monarchs created great new palaces with elaborate court rituals to dazzle the nobles and keep them occupied. Versailles is the greatest expression of this movement.

Actions

A. Don't build it

  • -50 victory points

B. Build the Palace

  • -500
  • Aristocracy +1
  • Centralization +1
  • +25 victory points

Back to top

90000049. Cessation of Church Functions to Nobility

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is catholic
    • State religion is counterreform
    • State religion is orthodox
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Noble families were often granted control over church lands and appointment in many states in exchange for cash contributions to the crown's efforts. The crown, of course, lost control over some revenues this way in exhange for a short term boost in revenue.

Actions

A. Decline

  • -5 victory points

B. Accept

  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • +100

Back to top

92009073. Chartering of a University

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Infrastructure tech is at 10 or higher
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is sunni
    • State religion is eastern_sunni
    • State religion is shia
    • State religion is eastern_shia
    • State religion is buddhist
    • State religion is jain
    • State religion is confucian

Description

Our advisors recommend that we charter a new University to support science and development. Should we heed their advice?

Actions

A. No

  • -50 victory points

B. Yes

  • Infrastructure tech investment: +250
  • Innovativeness +1
  • -200

96000057. Cities Demand Old Rights

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • Centralization is at 2 or higher

Description

Urban dwellers had always existed under a different code of rules than their rural brethren - even in the same state. Just as monarchs looked to curb the privileges of nobles they often tried to bring cities under more uniform rules and regulations. The cities often resisted these efforts.

Actions

A. Deny Old Rights

  • Stability -2

B. Accept

  • Centralization -1

Back to top

  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • Aristocracy is at 4 or higher
  • Centralization is at 6 or higher

  • Stability -2

96009120. Citizens request greater role in government

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Innovativeness is at 6 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 9 or higher
  • Country has at least 80 non-colonial provinces

Description

Now that our empire extends beyond its original borders, many citizens feel that it is right for them to gain more autonomy in their day-to-day rule.

Actions

A. Give in to their demands

  • Stability -1
  • Centralization -1
  • Aristocracy -1
  • Serfdom -2
  • -6 colonists
  • -6 missionaries
  • Global revolt risk +5 for 24 months
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base manpower in the same province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base manpower in the same province

B. We will remain a tightly-bound empire

  • Stability -2
  • Serfdom +1
  • Global revolt risk +5 for 96 months
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • Create a colonial revolt in a random province
  • Create a colonial revolt in a random province
  • Create a religious revolt in a random province
  • Create a religious revolt in a random province

Back to top

96019120. Citizens request greater role in government

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Country has at least 80 non-colonial provinces
  • Innovativeness is at 9 or higher

Description

Now that our empire extends beyond its original borders, many citizens feel that it is right for them to gain more autonomy in their day-to-day rule.

Actions

A. Give in to their demands

  • Stability -1
  • Centralization -1
  • Aristocracy -1
  • Serfdom -2
  • -6 colonists
  • -6 missionaries
  • Global revolt risk +5 for 24 months
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts

  • -1 base manpower in the same province

  • -1 base manpower in the same province

  • Lose bailiff in the same province

96000103. Clergy Criticizes Monarch

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 3 non-colonial provinces
  • Innovativeness is at 2 or higher
  • Centralization is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 6 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is catholic
    • State religion is counterreform
    • State religion is shia

Description

While there were certain advantages to having a powerful clergy, it could prove most inconvenient when they meddled in politics. Some even dared chastise the monarch openly for minor religious infractions like adultery, murder, or greed, to name a few.

Actions

A. Cave in to their demands

  • Centralization -1
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill -2 for 30 months
  • Monarch's administrative skill -2 for 30 months
  • Monarch's military skill -2 for 30 months

B. I want their heads on a platter!

  • Stability -2
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 60 months
  • A random province revolts
  • -2 missionaries

Back to top

91000111. Colonial Dynamism

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • It is the year 1550 or later
  • Capital is on continent Europe
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Colonial expansion led to a growing desire among people to move from their homeland to the New World in search of a new better life or to achieve fame and wealth through exploration colonization and conquest.

Actions

A. OK

  • Gain a conquistador in a random province
  • +2 colonists

From time to time the colonists rebelled due to high taxes or duties lack of attention or cruel Governors. Similarly white men's oppression led to outbursts of native rebellion or slave revolts.

Actions

A. OK

  • Create a colonial revolt in a random province
  • Create a colonial revolt in the same province
  • Create a colonial revolt in a random province
  • Create a colonial revolt in the same province
  • Create a colonial revolt in a random province
  • Create a colonial revolt in the same province
  • Create a colonial revolt in a random province
  • Create a colonial revolt in the same province

  • Create a colonial revolt in the same province

92000076. Commissioning of a Buddhist Temple

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Stability is at 3 or higher
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is buddhist
    • State religion is confucian

Description

Our advisors recommend that we commission a new Buddhist Temple in honor of the newly declared Buddha. Should we heed their advice?

Actions

A. No, there are enough temples already

  • -20 victory points

B. Yes! We should honor this new Budha!

  • Stability +2
  • -200
  • +1 missionaries

Back to top

Actions

A. OK

  • Gain a conquistador in a random province
  • +2 colonists

94009118. Contentment and Compantency in the Populace

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Country is not at war
  • Stability is at 0 or higher
  • Country has at least 80 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 200 non-colonial provinces

Description

Do to the overwhelming fear and might our country has on the rest of the world, the populace has become complacent and lax. This extends even to the military where there training suffers, fortresses are left to nature and recruitment is harder as the populace shifts its efforts elsewhere.

Actions

A. But we still need the military...

  • Stability +2
  • Land tech investment: -500
  • Naval tech investment: -500
  • Infrastructure tech investment: +250
  • Trade tech investment: +250
  • Quality -1
  • Fortress level in the capital province -2
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -2
  • -3 national manpower

Back to top

  • Stability +3
  • Land tech investment: -1000
  • Naval tech investment: -1000
  • Infrastructure tech investment: +500
  • Trade tech investment: +500
  • Quality -1
  • Fortress level in the capital province -3
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -1

96000090. Conversion by the Sword

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 4 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is confucian

Description

While often conversion to another faith was done by persuasion, sometimes zealous fanatics would get out of hand and demand conversion of a population or death.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability -1
  • A random province converts to the state religion
  • -1000 population in the same province
  • The same province revolts

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Corruption is one of the most common and frequent factors of political and economic life as always but all the more so in feudal regimes.

Actions

A. Try to eradicate the problems

  • Stability -2
  • -25

B. Ignore them

  • +1% inflation

90000032. Creation of Bank

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • It is the year 1650 or later
  • Centralization is at 3 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • Have more than 100,0% inflation
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is pagan
  • Infrastructure tech is at 7 or higher

Description

The creation of a centralized state bank brought serious improvement to the economic life of a country, as it helped stabilize the currency and regulate the state budgets.

Actions

A. OK

  • -3% inflation
  • +75

Back to top

94000032. Creation of Bank

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • It is the year 1650 or later
  • Centralization is at 3 or higher
  • Country has at least 80 non-colonial provinces
  • Have more than 100,0% inflation
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 200 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is pagan
  • Infrastructure tech is at 7 or higher

Description

The creation of a centralized state bank brought serious improvement to the economic life of a country, as it helped stabilize the currency and regulate the state budgets.

Actions

A. OK

  • -3% inflation
  • +500

    • State religion is reformed
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Capital is on continent Europe
    • Capital is on continent Americas

Actions

A. OK

  • +1 merchants
  • Trade tech investment: +250

90000033. Creation of Stock Exchange

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • It is the year 1750 or later
  • Infrastructure tech is at 7 or higher
  • Trade tech is at 9 or higher
  • Have more than 100,0% inflation
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is catholic
    • State religion is counterreform
    • State religion is protestant
    • State religion is reformed
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Capital is on continent Europe
    • Capital is on continent Americas

Description

The creation of a Stock Exchange paved the way for the early forms of capitalism and signaled the start of easier access to financing, thereby improving the economic life of a country.

Actions

A. OK

  • -2% inflation
  • +25
  • Infrastructure tech investment: +250

96000106. Death and Taxes

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 16 non-colonial provinces

Description

In this world, nothing is certain but Death and Taxes. A certain tax collector has proven himself avaricious far beyond the norm of his profession. Executing him would sit well with the populace, but why punish success? What, then, shall be his fate?

Actions

A. Death

  • Stability +1
  • Lose bailiff in a random province

B. Taxes

  • +2 base tax value in the same province
  • The same province revolts

Back to top

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 16 non-colonial provinces
  • Serfdom is at 4 or higher

  • Lose bailiff in a random province

B. Taxes

  • The same province revolts

96000029. Deflation

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Have more than 200,0% inflation

Description

Rampant inflation originating from the vast inflow of silver and gold from the new world brought the Kingdom of Spain to bankruptcy in 1557 and 1597. However economic cycles led to reduction of inflation a process called deflation.

Actions

A. OK

  • -2% inflation

Back to top

92009108. Defortification Efforts

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Capital is on continent Europe
  • Country is not at war
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Aristocracy is at 10 or higher
  • It is the year 1601 or later
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1800 or later

Description

During the 16th and 17th centuries many european monarchs pulled down the fortifications of the nobility to reduce both their prestige and ability to wage war against the crown.

Actions

A. Burn, baby, burn!

  • Centralization +1
  • Fortress level in a random province -1

B. Damnit! I still need them!

  • Aristocracy +1

Back to top

94009114. Desertion and Degrendation of the Military

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Country is not at war
  • Badboy is at 40 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1600 or later
  • The following must not occur:
    • Stability is at 0 or higher
  • Country has at least 80 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 200 non-colonial provinces

Description

As our empire falls into chaos, the general morale of the military suffers. With no war to rally our troops against, they grow disgruntled. I fear this may be the beginning of the end.

Actions

A. So must it be

  • Stability -1
  • Monarch's military skill -2 for 6 months
  • Quality -1
  • Lose 10000 troops in a random province
  • Lose 10000 troops in a random province
  • Lose 10000 troops in a random province
  • Lose 10000 troops in a random province
  • Lose 20000 troops in a random province
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Fortress level in a random province -2

B. Hunt down the deserters!

  • Stability -3
  • -500
  • Lose 10000 troops in a random province
  • Fortress level in a random province -1
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 12 months

Back to top

96000030. Diplomatic Insult

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own

Description

Conflicts sometimes erupted following diplomatic insults.

Actions

A. OK

  • Gain a temporary casus belli against a random country for 6 months
  • -10 relations with the same country
  • -10 relations with a random country
  • -10 relations with a random country
  • -10 relations with a random country
  • -10 relations with a random country

Back to top

96020030. Diplomatic Insult

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own

Description

Conflicts sometimes erupted following diplomatic insults.

Actions

A. OK

  • Gain a temporary casus belli against a random country for 18 months
  • -35 relations with the same country
  • -10 relations with a random country
  • -10 relations with a random country
  • -10 relations with a random country
  • -10 relations with a random country

96000008. Diplomatic Move

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own

Description

Diplomacy between nations was often affected by random factors from both sides involved that were most of the time beyond the control of the foreign ministers involved.

Actions

A. OK

  • Monarch's diplomatic skill +1 for 4 months
  • +25 relations with a random country
  • +1 diplomats

960000127. Dragomans

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • Ottoman Empire owns Byzantion
  • Ottoman Empire controls Byzantion
  • Country is not at war
  • Capital is on continent Europe

Description

Dragoman designates the official title of a person who would function as an interpreter, translator and official guide between the Ottomans and European embassies. In the Ottoman Empire, the demand for the mediation provided by dragomans is said to have been created by the reluctance on the part of the Muslim Ottomans to learn the languages of non-Muslim nations. The office incorporated diplomatic as well as linguistic duties namely, in the Ottomans relation with Christian countries and some dragomans thus came to play crucial roles in Ottoman politics.

Actions

A. Peaceful politics

  • +2 merchants
  • Trade tech investment: +100
  • +20 relations with Ottoman Empire

Back to top

96009123. Effects of Reforms wear off

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • Flag [Random_MajorRef] is set

Description

Our efforts to reform and lessen the strain on our bureaucracy has been fruitful, but as time passes, even new reforms turn old...

Actions

A. Thrown away money

  • Clear flag "[Random_MajorRef]"
  • Set flag [Random_MinorRef] for events
  • Infrastructure tech investment: -10

Back to top

96019123. Effects of Reforms wear off

  • Flag [Random_MinorRef] is set

Our efforts to reform and lessen the strain on our bureaucracy has been fruitful, but as time passes, even new reforms turn old...

Actions

  • Clear flag "[Random_MinorRef]"
  • Infrastructure tech investment: -5

Back to top

96000139. Effects of the Industrial Revolution

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • Event 111 - The Industrial Revolution for all countries has already occurred
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Capital is on continent Europe
    • Capital is in the region North America
  • Infrastructure tech is at 9 or higher
  • Trade tech is at 9 or higher
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Land tech is at 51 or higher
    • Naval tech is at 51 or higher
  • Stability is at 3 or higher
  • Innovativeness is at 7 or higher
  • None of the following must occur:
    • Serfdom is at 4 or higher
    • Aristocracy is at 6 or higher

Description

The Industrial Revolution had profound and far-reaching effects on society, economics and culture. It ushered in an era of unprecedented technological advancements and economic growth, leading to increased industrialization and urbanization. Factories and mechanized production processes transformed work and created a new working class, while innovations in transportation, such as the steam engine and railways, revolutionized trade and communication. However, these changes also brought challenges, including harsh working conditions, child labor, and social inequalities. The Industrial Revolution reshaped the family structure, with more people working outside the home, and had significant impacts on the environment due to increased pollution and resource extraction. It ultimately laid the foundation for the modern industrial societies we see today.

Actions

A. Modernity has been thrust upon us!

  • +500
  • +1% inflation
  • +5 base tax value in a random province
  • +2 base manpower in the same province
  • +15% population in the same province
  • Gain Goods Manufactory in the same province

Back to top

96010139. Effects of the Industrial Revolution

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • Event 111 - The Industrial Revolution for all countries has already occurred
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Capital is on continent Europe
    • Capital is in the region North America
  • Infrastructure tech is at 9 or higher
  • Trade tech is at 9 or higher
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Land tech is at 51 or higher
    • Naval tech is at 51 or higher
  • Stability is at 3 or higher
  • Innovativeness is at 7 or higher
  • None of the following must occur:
    • Serfdom is at 4 or higher
    • Aristocracy is at 6 or higher

Description

The Industrial Revolution had profound and far-reaching effects on society, economics and culture. It ushered in an era of unprecedented technological advancements and economic growth, leading to increased industrialization and urbanization. Factories and mechanized production processes transformed work and created a new working class, while innovations in transportation, such as the steam engine and railways, revolutionized trade and communication. However, these changes also brought challenges, including harsh working conditions, child labor, and social inequalities. The Industrial Revolution reshaped the family structure, with more people working outside the home, and had significant impacts on the environment due to increased pollution and resource extraction. It ultimately laid the foundation for the modern industrial societies we see today.

Actions

A. Modernity has been thrust upon us!

  • +15000 infantry in a random province
  • +25 artillery in the same province
  • +5 base tax value in the same province
  • +2 base manpower in the same province
  • +15% population in the same province
  • Gain Weapons Manufactory in the same province

92008101. Emigration to the New World

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by AI
  • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces
  • Capital is on continent Europe
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces

Description

Whether in search of faith, wealth, land, or freedom, many people emigrated to the colonies, bringing with them new crafts, skills, and unfulfilled dreams.

Actions

A. So mote it be

  • +1000 population in a different random province
  • +1 base tax value in the same province

96009093. Enforcement of Jizya

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Country has at least 1 missionaries
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is sunni
    • State religion is eastern_sunni
    • State religion is shia
    • State religion is eastern_shia
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Own Kutch
    • Own Diu
    • Own Rajkot
    • Own Gujarat
    • Own Baroda
    • Own Surat
    • Own Daman
    • Own Thalner
    • Own Burhanpur
    • Own Bhopal
    • Own Ujjain
    • Own Mewar
    • Own Ajmer
    • Own Jaipur
    • Own Marwar
    • Own Bikaner
    • Own Jaisalmer
    • Own Delhi
    • Own Agra
    • Own Canpore
    • Own Rohilkhand
    • Own Awadh
    • Own Benares
    • Own Udaipur
    • Own Raipur
    • Own Bundelkhand
    • Own Gwalior
    • Own Jabalpur
    • Own Gondwana
    • Own Berar
    • Own Nander
    • Own Daulatabad
    • Own Ahmadnagar
    • Own Bombay
    • Own Goa
    • Own Konkan
    • Own Bijapur
    • Own Raichur Doab
    • Own Bidar
    • Own Golconda
    • Own Warangal
    • Own Guntur
    • Own Bandar
    • Own Nellore
    • Own Kurnool
    • Own Vijayanagar
    • Own Mysore
    • Own Bangalore
    • Own Coimbatore
    • Own Thanjavur
    • Own Madurai
    • Own Travancore
    • Own Calicut
    • Own Kanara
    • Own Cannanore
    • Own Cochin
    • Own Tranquebar
    • Own Carnatic
    • Own Madras
    • Own Yanam
    • Own Circars
    • Own Katak
    • Own Orissa
    • Own Palikamedi
    • Own Bastar
    • Own Hugli
    • Own Kolkata
    • Own Bengalen
    • Own Sargeon
    • Own Bihar
    • Own Dinapur
    • Own Ahom
    • Own Nepala
    • Own Gurkha
    • Own Simla
    • Own Kamata
  • Capital is on continent Asia
  • Innovativeness is at 2 or higher

Description

Islam in South Asia often dropped or did not enforce the imposition of Jizya, a tax on Zimmis, non-believers who are protected by the state. Instead, in order to smooth relations with the dominantly Hindu populations, they classified them as Musta'min, protected non-Muslims exempt from Jizya. In history, however, there was always a movement from conservative factions to impose Jizya. Imposing it would bring revolts, and refusing to do so would build trust with the Hindu community, while losing it with elements of the Islamic elite.

Actions

A. Don't enforce Jizya

  • Trade tech investment: +50
  • Infrastructure tech investment: +50
  • -1 missionaries

B. Listen to the clerics

  • +80
  • Stability -1
  • Innovativeness -1

Back to top

Conditions

    • Own
  • Land is at 3 or higher
  • Country has at least 200 non-colonial provinces

Description

The Army often provided a shelter for the homeless and jobless. In times of crisis, volunteers would flock to the ranks.

Actions

A. OK

  • +5000 infantry in a random province
  • +5000 infantry in a random province
  • +5000 infantry in a random province
  • +5000 infantry in a random province

90009072. Exceptional Court Painter Available

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Capital is on continent Europe
    • Capital is on continent Asia

Description

Courts were often looking for painters and artists to try to adequately capture the glory of the monarch. Artists during the Renaissance were usually multi-talented and worked in many fields other than art. Michelangelo worked in fortifications and da Vinci dabbled in engineering for example.

Actions

A. Decline his Services

  • -1 victory points

B. Hire Painter

  • -25
  • Innovativeness +1
  • +1 victory points

Back to top

96000006. Exceptional Year

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at 2 or higher
  • Have more than 100,0% inflation

Description

Excellent business environment combined with good harvests were once in a while a blessing for the nation's tax base generating higher income for the realm.

Actions

A. Add the excess revenue to the treasury

  • +100
  • -2% inflation

B. Reinvest it in the local economy

  • +1 base tax value in a random province

C. Use the excess revenue to expand commerce

  • Infrastructure tech investment: +100
  • Trade tech investment: +100

D. Use the excess revenue for military needs

  • Land tech investment: +100
  • Naval tech investment: +100

Back to top

96000034. Explorer

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Naval tech is at 11 or higher
  • Trade tech is at 3 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Land is at 5 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is pagan
  • It is the year 1601 or later

Description

A bold captain has put himself his ship and his crew at our disposal to win glory for God and country! The vast tract of still unknown sea lanes and unexplored lands would always attract seamen in search of adventure fame and wealth.

Actions

A. OK

  • Gain an explorer in a random province
  • +2 colonists

Back to top

91000061. Foreign Drill Instructor Available

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • It is the year 1600 or later
  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Capital is on continent Europe
  • The following must not occur:
    • Offensive Doctrine is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Quality is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Maurice of Orange pioneered new drills for firearms that made the new weapons much more effective. This drill technique was not a secret and numerous military entrepreneurs read on the drill and placed their service at the disposal of the crowned heads of Europe.

Actions

A. Decline the Offer

  • -1 victory points

B. Hire him

  • -250
  • Offensive Doctrine +1
  • Quality +1
  • +1000 infantry in a random province

Back to top

  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • Mercantilism is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Mercantilism is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Trade tech is at 10 or higher

Description

Trade was heavily regulated during this era but despite this the markets were not fixed. At times merchants would try to enter new markets or sell new goods. Merchants facing these conditions would usually demand new or higher tariffs to stop their competitors.

Actions

A. Impose New Tariff

  • Mercantilism +1

B. Deny New Tariff

  • Mercantilism -1
  • Trade tech investment: -100

Back to top

91009071. Foreign Trade Competition Rises

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces
  • Mercantilism is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:

91000031. Fortification Effort

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Infrastructure tech is at 3 or higher
  • Country has at least 6 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces

Description

A permanent matter of regal attention fortification of the realm always received great care, particularly at the border or in strategic places such as capitals major shipyards or important colonies.

Actions

A. OK

  • Fortress level in a random province +1

Back to top

90000018. Good Government Policies

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Stability is at 3 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Trade tech is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Infrastructure tech is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Changes of policies when cleverly timed and made were often well perceived by the people of the time beyond their actual efficiency as a proof of the government's good will and interest in the welfare of the realm.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability +1
  • Infrastructure tech investment: +100
  • Trade tech investment: +100

Back to top

96000092. Goodwill towards all

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is not at war
  • Country has at least 6 missionaries
  • Innovativeness is at 7 or higher

Description

During times of peace and prosperity, the people are more accepting of others' differences, being willing to allow them to share in the plentiful bounty of the realm.

Actions

A. OK

  • -6 missionaries
  • Global revolt risk -1 for 12 months

Back to top

90000053. Grant Export Licences

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Trade tech is at 3 or higher
  • It is the year 1650 or later
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is catholic
    • State religion is counterreform
    • State religion is protestant
    • State religion is reformed
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Capital is on continent Europe
    • Capital is on continent Americas

Description

When the crown could not or would not pay cash to the nobles they would grant them instead privileges to collect special revenues from which they could make a healthy profit.

Actions

A. Decline

  • Stability -1

B. Accept

  • -20

Back to top

Actions

A. Accept

  • -200

B. Decline

  • Stability -1

Back to top

90000069. Great Noble Family Requests Aid

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

The most powerful of the noble families in the state often had vast wealth but that did not stop them like their monarchs from getting into financial troubles. They too could accumulate debts that escaped their ability to pay. They could at those times come to the monarch to request aid. The monarchs were often receptive since they would usually be related by blood or marriage.

Actions

A. Deny Aid

  • Stability -2

B. Grant Aid

  • -25

Back to top

91000009. Great Reputation

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Badboy is at 40 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Diplomacy between nations was often affected by the fame and numerous other achievements of a nation. Her diplomats would capitalize on those factors to achieve better results than usual in their negotiations.

Actions

A. OK

  • Monarch's diplomatic skill +1 for 24 months
  • +1 diplomats
  • +10 relations with a random country
  • +10 relations with a random country
  • +10 relations with a random country

Back to top

96000080. Great royal hunt

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at 1 or higher
  • Country is not at war

Description

From time to time most rulers liked to arrange great royal hunts. These occasions were quite popular, but far from everyone were invited to participate - being invited to a royal hunt was a clear indication of favour. As with similar occasions, this was used by the King to diplomatically demonstrate his current favorites among the nobility as well as the foreign dignitaries.

Actions

A. OK

  • +15 relations with a random country
  • -15 relations with a random country
  • +15 relations with a random country
  • -15 relations with a random country
  • +15 relations with a random country
  • -15 relations with a random country

Back to top

96000043. Guru visits our land

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • State religion is hindu

Description

A holy guru has visited our land. The people see this as a sign of good favor for our rule!

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability +1
  • Global revolt risk -1 for 12 months

Back to top

96000084. Heirless noble dies

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Stability is at 3 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Aristocracy is at 10 or higher
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Occasionally a rural land owner died without a heir, and his lands would revert to the crown.

Actions

A. Directly administrate

  • +30
  • +1 base tax value in a random province

B. Grant them to a noble

  • Stability +1
  • Aristocracy +1

Back to top

92000036. Heretics

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 6 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is confucian

Description

Despite various official religious policies to eradicate heresy the population of some provinces was sometimes strongly attached to their faith and resisted conversion. Similarly, new faiths would also engage in missionary activity and manage to convert whole regions to their own belief.

Actions

A. OK

  • Create a religious revolt in a random province
  • Create a religious revolt in a random province

Back to top

96000113. High-ranking noble arranges a marriage

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is not at war
  • The following must not occur:
    • Aristocracy is at 5 or higher

Description

While most marriages of the nobility were done within the realm, often the upper nobility would marry off their children to other countries for various political and financial reasons.

Actions

A. OK

  • Gain a royal marriage with -1

Back to top

96000063. Indulgence peddler in our domain

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • State religion is catholic
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1514 or later

Description

Indulgences were essentially a pre-pay system for our sins. A devotee could buy forgiveness before they committed sins. This practice was widely practiced and its abuse was one of the prompts for Luther's movement. Indulgence peddlers were very apt at extracting large amounts of cash from any area they passed through.

Actions

A. OK

  • -1 base tax value in a random province

Back to top

91000039. Internal Trade Ordinance

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Ordinances provided that roads, post relays and taverns be properly maintained to ensure the smooth flow of trade within a state.

Actions

A. OK

  • +1 base tax value in a random province

Back to top

  • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 80 non-colonial provinces

Description

Ordinances provided that roads, post relays and taverns be properly maintained to ensure the smooth flow of trade within a state.

Actions

A. OK

  • +1 base tax value in a random province
  • +1 base tax value in a random province
  • +1 base tax value in a random province

Back to top

All countries — Random

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own

91000060. Italian Engineer Available

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • It is the year 1450 or later
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1600 or later
  • Capital is on continent Europe
  • Offensive Doctrine is at 3 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

During the period from 1450-1600 Italian siege engineers were highly sought after to teach the ways of the trace italienne to the militaries of Europe. These engineers had no national identity in most cases and simply worked for whoever could afford to pay them.

Actions

A. Decline the Offer

  • -1 victory points

B. Hire the engineer

  • -75
  • Offensive Doctrine -1
  • Fortress level in a random province +1

Back to top

96000122. Maintenance of shipping

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Naval tech is at 4 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Naval tech is at 11 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Trade tech is at 5 or higher

Description

Careening a sailing vessel means to beach it at high tide in order, usually, to expose one side or another of the ship's hull for maintenance below the water line when the tide goes out. Maintenance includes, dry rot or cannon shot repair, tarring the exterior to reduce leakage or barnacle removal to increase her speed. Commercial shipping was maintained by the merchants.

Actions

A. Unable to pay

  • Trade tech investment: -50

B. Fix and clean

  • -50
  • Trade tech investment: +100

Back to top

96010122. Maintenance of shipping

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Naval tech is at 4 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Naval tech is at 18 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Trade tech is at 9 or higher

Description

Careening a sailing vessel means to beach it at high tide in order, usually, to expose one side or another of the ship's hull for maintenance below the water line when the tide goes out. Maintenance includes, dry rot or cannon shot repair, tarring the exterior to reduce leakage or barnacle removal to increase her speed. Commercial shipping was maintained by the merchants.

Actions

A. Unable to pay

  • Trade tech investment: -100

B. Fix and clean

  • -100
  • Trade tech investment: +200

96009119. Massive Religious Uprisings

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Innovativeness is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 6 or higher
  • Badboy is at 20 or higher
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Badboy is at 40 or higher
    • Country has at least 80 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1600 or later

Description

With the growth in the size of our empire we've absorbed multiple cultures and religions into our nation, but our singling out of our faith has caused us no end of troubles and now it looks as things are about to boil over.

Actions

A. Try to head off this disaster!

  • Stability -1
  • Innovativeness +1
  • -500
  • Global revolt risk +5 for 12 months
  • A random province revolts

B. We shall not give into them!

  • Stability -2
  • Global revolt risk +4 for 60 months
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • Create a religious revolt in a random province
  • Create a religious revolt in a random province
  • Create a religious revolt in a random province
  • Create a religious revolt in a random province

Back to top

91000086. Mercenary band demands subsidies

All countries — Random

Conditions

    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Centralization is at 10 or higher

    • It is the year 1700 or later
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

  • Stability -1
  • Centralization +1
  • A random province revolts
  • -1 base tax value in the same province

B. Give in to their demands

  • -100
  • +5000 infantry in the same province
  • +2500 cavalry in the same province
  • Quality -1

90000067. Merchants Harassed

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Disputes over the treatment of local merchants were not uncommon. All governments faced minor reports of unfair treatment and harassment of their merchants. At the higher levels there were complaints about banditry or privateering occuring within or at the direction of a certain state. These issues could be resolved but saber rattling was always an option.

Actions

A. Escalate Complaint

  • Gain a temporary casus belli against a random country for 60 months
  • -25 relations with the same country

B. Diplomatically Resolve

  • +50 relations with the same country
  • Trade tech investment: -100

Back to top

90009100. Merchants request help

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Trade tech is at 1 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Trade tech is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • Mercantilism is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Mercantilism is at 10 or higher

Description

Central authority has quite often required both financial and political support of the merchant oligarchy to conduct its domestic and international policies, paying in return with higher protection and lower taxation.

Actions

A. Refuse to help

  • Stability -1
  • Trade tech investment: +250

B. Help them out

  • Trade tech investment: -250
  • -50
  • Mercantilism +1

Back to top

96000040. Meteor Sighted

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own

Description

The peasants were always superstitious, and the appearance of a meteor in the sky could cause panic among the people. This was often viewed as a sign that the end of times were near or that something bad would happen in the near future.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability -1
  • Global revolt risk +1 for 12 months

91009117. Militarization of Society

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Badboy is at 40 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1600 or later
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Founded on expansion, the society is gradually militarized to the detriment of local economies.

Actions

A. So mote it be

  • +1 badboy
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • +1 base manpower in the same province
  • +1 base tax value in the capital province
  • +1 base manpower in the capital province

  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • +1 base manpower in the same province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • +1 base manpower in the same province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • +1 base manpower in the same province
  • +1 base tax value in the capital province
  • +1 base manpower in the capital province

94009117. Militarization of Society

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Badboy is at 40 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1600 or later
  • Country has at least 80 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 200 non-colonial provinces

Description

Founded on expansion, the society is gradually militarized to the detriment of local economies.

Actions

A. So mote it be

  • +1 badboy
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province

90000089. Military Advisor

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Quality is at 10 or higher

Description

A brilliant infantry captain, dismissed from another Kingdom after an injury preventing him from taking the field, has come to our court seeking employment. He does, however, have a rather inflated opinion of his own talent, and has already made himself unpopular with the nobles of the court.

Actions

A. Send him away

  • -1 victory points

B. Retain him as an advisor

  • -50
  • Monarch's military skill +1 for 60 months
  • Quality +1

Back to top

960000124. Military Reformation

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • Country is not at war
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1494 or later
  • Quality is at 4 or higher

Description

During the late middle ages and the early renaissance, all armies where based of a feudal system in which the nobles would have a small number of professional troops and would hire the local militia, which was minimally trained to raise the troop numbers when needed, wars and campaigns with this method tended to last longer and where mostly indecisive partly due to the militia departing for home to tend to their farms during certain times of the year. Quality only belonged to the mercenary, the Men of arms.

Actions

A. Reformation

  • Offensive Doctrine -1
  • Quality -1

B. Status quo

  • -200
  • Land tech investment: -500
  • +2000 cavalry in a random province
  • +2000 infantry in the same province

Back to top

96000085. Monastic Clashes

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • State religion is hindu
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 3 or higher

Description

Though Hinduism is diverse and encompasses several coexisting religious traditions, peace is not always the norm. Theistic and political arguments could break out between different Hindu monasteries. The medieval era saw frequent clashes between Shaivite and Vaishnavite monks when the question of political favor or doctrinal issues arose.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability -1

Back to top

90000051. Monopoly Company Formed

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Trade tech is at 3 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Crowns often granted trading companies the exclusive rights to traffic in goods in a region. These monopolies were granted in exchange for a lump-sum payment and continuing revenues from the traders.

Actions

A. OK

  • +1 merchants
  • +50

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

During this time period many areas that were forests or swamps were cleared or drained to provide new areas for settlement. These newly cleared areas often led to a short term population boom.

Actions

A. OK

  • +1000 population in a random province
  • +1 base manpower in the same province
  • +1 base tax value in the same province

91000097. New Tax

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Monarchs always sought ways to finance their wars, great constructions, and reforms. The most effective method, new taxes, often fell on the heads of peasants and burghers.

Actions

A. Introduce new tax

  • Stability -2
  • +1 base tax value in a random province
  • The same province revolts

B. Let the matter fall

  • Aristocracy +1
  • Monarch's administrative skill -2 for 4 months

94009116. Nobility Ignoring Orders

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Country has at least 80 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 200 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Centralization is at 6 or higher

Description

Our weak bureaucracy has allowed the nobility and some of the governors to refuse or, at the best, not completely enforcing our decrees unless it suits them. This is known to happen from time to time, it has become commonplace and we do not have the bureaucratic power to stop them. While they are not openly defying us right now, pressuring them may change their attitude, but doing nothing will leave us at their mercy.

Actions

A. Force them to comply diplomatically!

  • Stability -2
  • Centralization +1
  • Aristocracy -1
  • -1000
  • -2 diplomats

B. Use military force to make them comply!

  • Stability -4
  • Centralization +2
  • Aristocracy -1
  • Offensive Doctrine +1
  • Global revolt risk +4 for 36 months
  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • The same province revolts

C. Let the issue slide

  • Stability -1
  • Centralization -2
  • Aristocracy +2
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base manpower in the same province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base manpower in the same province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base manpower in the same province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base manpower in the same province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base manpower in the same province
  • -2 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base manpower in the same province

91000046. Noble Families Feud

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • Aristocracy is at 4 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Violence among leading families within a state was never far from the surface. Often, this instability would boil over into open confilict. The result was less than a full blown civil war but could immensely disturb the stability of a state.

Actions

A. Side with one family

  • A random province revolts

B. Let them fight it out.

  • Stability -3

C. Try to settle the issue.

  • -50

Back to top

92000046. Noble Families Feud

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • Aristocracy is at 4 or higher
  • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces

Description

Violence among leading families within a state was never far from the surface. Often, this instability would boil over into open confilict. The result was less than a full blown civil war but could immensely disturb the stability of a state.

Actions

A. Side with one family

  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts

B. Let them fight it out.

  • Stability -2

C. Try to settle the issue.

  • -100

Back to top

93000046. Noble Families Feud

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • Aristocracy is at 4 or higher
  • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces

Description

Violence among leading families within a state was never far from the surface. Often, this instability would boil over into open confilict. The result was less than a full blown civil war but could immensely disturb the stability of a state.

Actions

A. Side with one family

  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • The same province revolts

B. Let them fight it out.

  • Stability -1

C. Try to settle the issue.

  • -250

Back to top

96000047. Nobles Ally with Foreign Power

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Aristocracy is at 3 or higher

Description

The nobility was not fully subjugated during this age and the nobles could and did strike independent alliances with foreign princes. The crowns of Europe might not have liked it but they were normally hard pressed to prevent these kinds of activities.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability -1
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against a random country for 24 months

Back to top

90000052. Nobles Demand Increased Pensions

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Aristocracy is at 7 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Kings had to keep their unruly nobles in line through many methods. One of the most common was cold hard cash. Nobles would demand increased pensions in exchange for relinquishing certain rights to the King.

Actions

A. Refuse their demands

  • Stability -2

B. Accept their demands

  • -75

Back to top

96000056. Nobles Demand Old Rights

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Aristocracy is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Centralization is at 2 or higher

Description

The nobility during this period still recalled the days when the King was just the first among many nobles. The nobility wanted to return to these days and would frequently pressure the King to regain certain lost rights of privileges.

Actions

A. Reject Demands

  • Stability -2

B. Accept Demands

  • Centralization -1
  • Aristocracy +1

96000037. Nobles demand recovery of former rights

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Aristocracy is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Aristocracy is at 10 or higher

Description

The privileges of the nobility were continually under assault as the monarch tried to centralize more and more control. Sometimes the nobles would attempt to gain rights they had lost or surrendered to the monarch in earlier times.

Actions

A. Accept their rightful claims

  • Aristocracy +1

B. Execute the Traitors

  • Stability -1
  • Aristocracy -1

C. Ignore the demands

  • Global revolt risk +2 for 24 months

91000095. Nobles refuse to pay taxes

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Aristocracy is at 5 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Centralization is at 8 or higher
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Weak central authority often led to nobles ignoring it, and refusing to pay taxes, or supply troops for campaigns.

Actions

A. Execute the troublemakers

  • Stability -3
  • Aristocracy -1
  • Centralization +1
  • A random province revolts

B. Let the incident slide

  • -30

92000096. Nobles seek to subjugate the peasants

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Aristocracy is at 2 or higher
  • Serfdom is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Serfdom is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Aristocracy is at 10 or higher
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces

Description

Actions

A. Do nothing

  • Stability -2
  • Serfdom +1
  • Aristocracy +1
  • +50
  • A random province revolts

B. Protect peasants

  • Stability -1
  • Serfdom -1
  • Aristocracy -1

96000058. Non-enforcement of Ordinances

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Centralization is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Centralization is at 10 or higher

Description

Monarchs ruled by issuing ordinances but they were almost powerless to enforce them. Enforcement depended upon the local powers (nobles/city governments) who would not always be as vigilant as the monarchs would have desired.

Actions

A. Enforce it

  • Stability -2
  • Centralization +1

B. Ignore it

  • Stability +1
  • Centralization -1

Back to top

90000088. Noted Diplomat

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

A noted diplomat has offered his services as an advisor to the court. Though a brilliant negotiator, he is accustomed to a high standard of living, and expects to be very well-compensated.

Actions

A. Send him away

  • -1 victory points

B. Retain him as an advisor

  • -75
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill +1 for 60 months
  • +1 diplomats
  • +10 relations with a random country
  • +10 relations with a random country

Back to top

94009115. Overly Stretched Bureaucracy

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Centralization is at 6 or higher
  • Country has at least 80 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 200 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Flag [Random_MinorRef] is set
  • The following must not occur:
    • Flag [Random_MajorRef] is set

Description

The pace of our bureaucratic system has been unable to keep up with the increase in the size of our nation and has now become critical. If we don't do something now, there will be severe consequences for us.

Actions

A. Minor Reforms

  • Stability -1
  • -1000
  • Infrastructure tech investment: -100
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • Set flag [Random_MinorRef] for events

B. Ignore the Situation

  • Centralization -1
  • Infrastructure tech investment: -1000
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province

C. Initate a complete overhaul!

  • Stability -3
  • Centralization +1
  • -2000
  • Infrastructure tech investment: +150
  • Set flag [Random_MajorRef] for events

D. Crush the state within the state!

  • Centralization -2
  • Stability -6
  • +750
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 24 months
  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • A random province revolts

95009115. Overly Stretched Bureaucracy

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Country has at least 200 non-colonial provinces
  • Centralization is at 6 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Flag [Random_MinorRef] is set
  • The following must not occur:
    • Flag [Random_MajorRef] is set

Description

The pace of our bureaucratic system has been unable to keep up with the increase in the size of our nation and has now become critical. If we don't do something now, there will be severe consequences for us.

Actions

A. Minor Reforms

  • Stability -1
  • -1500
  • Infrastructure tech investment: -250
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -2 base tax value in a random province
  • Set flag [Random_MinorRef] for events

B. Ignore the Situation

  • Centralization -1
  • Infrastructure tech investment: -2000
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • -2 base tax value in a random province
  • -2 base tax value in a random province
  • -2 base tax value in a random province

C. Initate a complete overhaul!

  • Stability -3
  • Centralization +1
  • -2500
  • Infrastructure tech investment: +250
  • Set flag [Random_MajorRef] for events

D. Crush the state within the state!

  • Stability -6
  • Centralization -2
  • +1500
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 24 months
  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • A random province revolts

91000082. Petition for Redress

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -1 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Centralization is at 10 or higher
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Peasants typically had no voice but they could occasionally gain access to the monarch and ask for redress. Sometimes, these requests for redress would be directed at the local lord who was perceived to be violating the peasants' rights. Stepping in to override a noble's local authority was a very drastic step.

Actions

A. Accept Petition

  • Stability -4
  • Centralization +1

B. Deny Petition

  • Stability -1
  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • The same province revolts

Back to top

96009087. Petition for a new religious order

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Stability is at 3 or higher
  • Relations with Papal States are at -190 or higher
  • Capital is on continent Europe
  • Innovativeness is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 10 or higher
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is catholic
    • State religion is counterreform

Description

A devout prior has petitioned us to support a new religious order. Of course, virtue is not free, and a small bequest would reinforce our already widespread reputation for charity.

Actions

A. Remind the prior of his vow of poverty

  • Stability -1
  • -10 relations with Papal States

B. Support the monastic order

  • Stability +1
  • -50
  • +25 relations with Papal States
  • +1 missionaries
  • Innovativeness -1

C. Forbid the order and banish the prior

  • Stability -2
  • -100 relations with Papal States
  • -1 missionaries
  • Innovativeness +1

Back to top

90000012. Plague

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1550 or later
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Capital is on continent Americas

Description

Epidemics in the early-modern era were far deadlier than wars or even famine. Diseases that with modern medicine are relatively harmless like smallpox or flu took a heavy toll whenever they struck especially among infants.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability -1
  • -1000 population in a random province

Back to top

  • -1500 population in a random province
  • -1500 population in a random province
  • -1500 population in a random province
  • -1500 population in a random province
  • -1500 population in a random province
  • -1 base manpower in the same province

95030012. Plague

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 200 non-colonial provinces
  • It is the year 1550 or later
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • The following must not occur:
      • Capital is on continent Americas
    • All of the following must occur:
      • Capital is on continent Americas
      • The following must not occur:
        • State religion is pagan

Description

Epidemics in the early-modern era were far deadlier than wars or even famine. Diseases that with modern medicine are relatively harmless like smallpox or flu took a heavy toll whenever they struck especially among infants.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability -1
  • -1500 population in a random province
  • -1500 population in a random province
  • -1500 population in a random province
  • -1500 population in a random province
  • -1500 population in a random province
  • -1 base manpower in the same province
  • -1 base tax value in the same province

  • -1 base manpower in the same province

96000027. Political Crisis

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own

Description

Political crises may occur from time to time. They may involve a conflict between the ruler and the parliament or unrest among the nobility or conflicts of interest between the nobility and the merchants or religious leaders. In game terms these problems usually cause a loss of stability when they occur.

Actions

A. Don't take sides

  • Stability -1
  • Monarch's administrative skill -2 for 6 months

B. Side with one faction

  • Stability -1
  • Global revolt risk +1 for 12 months
  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts

Back to top

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Badboy is at 15 or higher

90000019. Poor Government Policies

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Trade tech is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Infrastructure tech is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Changes of policies when poorly timed and made were often wrongly perceived by the people of the time beyond their actual efficiency as a proof of the government ill will and lack of interest in the welfare of the realm.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability -1
  • Infrastructure tech investment: -100
  • Trade tech investment: -100

Back to top
