96008112. Pretender to the Throne

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by AI
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1789 or later
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is pagan

Description

After a domestic conflict the defeated leaders would try to gain support from neighbouring countries. Usually they would end up wandering across the countryside leaving a trail of unpaid bills behind them, but sometimes a country with an axe to grind against their homeland would support their claims.

Actions

A. Send him away

  • +10 relations with a random country

B. Support his claim

  • Gain a temporary casus belli against the same country for 18 months
  • -35 relations with the same country
  • -150
  • +5000 infantry in the capital province
  • +2000 cavalry in the capital province

Back to top

96009112. Pretender to the Throne

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1789 or later
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is pagan

Description

After a domestic conflict the defeated leaders would try to gain support from neighbouring countries. Usually they would end up wandering across the countryside leaving a trail of unpaid bills behind them, but sometimes a country with an axe to grind against their homeland would support their claims.

Actions

A. Send him away

  • +10 relations with a random country

B. Support his claim

  • Start a war with -3
  • -2 badboy
  • -35 relations with the same country
  • -150
  • +5000 infantry in the capital province
  • +2000 cavalry in the capital province

Back to top

960000126. Reaction -Third estate

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • Country is not at war
  • Offensive Doctrine is at 4 or higher
  • Quality is at 4 or higher

Description

States in Italy, Germany and the Netherlands had won their territories mainly by hiring mercenaries to do the fighting. At the beginning of the thirty years war, Gustavus Adolphus began by providing proper uniforms and training, gone was the multicoloured long smocks and peasant attire. As he stated, many will judge contemptuously of the infantry for its clothes sake. Cohesion by the foot soldiers and cavalry had begun. Quality was still a long way away.

Actions

A. Clothe them

  • Land +1
  • Quality -1
  • +1000 cavalry in a random province
  • +1000 infantry in the same province

B. Status quo

  • -200
  • Land tech investment: -500
  • +2000 cavalry in a random province
  • +2000 infantry in the same province

Back to top

960000125. Recruitment - second Estate

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • Country is not at war
  • Offensive Doctrine is at 4 or higher
  • Quality is at 4 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1621 or later

Description

Before Charles VIII 1494 invasion of Italy, army numbers tended to be only 5 percent of the population, ill trained and ill disciplined. Legally, most able bodied men from the ages of 15 to 60 were liable to serve. Recruiters rode, armed with their licenses to raise men, pay them and lead them. Training was usually only carried out weekly by the clergy after mass.

Actions

A. Hire them

  • Offensive Doctrine +1
  • Quality -1
  • +1000 infantry in a random province

B. Status quo

  • -200
  • Land tech investment: -500
  • +2000 cavalry in a random province
  • +2000 infantry in the same province

Back to top

90000013. Reformation of the Army

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Land is at 5 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Land tech is at 60 or higher

Description

Army reformation be it from new tactics weapons or command or any other reason often translated into better combat efficiency.

Actions

A. OK

  • Land tech investment: +250

Back to top

Navy reformation be it from new tactics weapons or command or any other reason often translated into better combat efficiency.

Actions

A. OK

  • Naval tech investment: +1000

Back to top

90000065. Regional Heresy

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Small bouts of heretical ideas would spring up from time to time. Most were simple people who did not realize that their interpretation of the Bible went counter to established doctrine but all such ideas frightened the local rulers. Intended or not, the usual response was quick and brutal as authorities would suppress these outbreaks.

Actions

A. Ignore Heresy

  • Stability -1

B. Fund suppression effort

  • -50

Back to top

96000068. Regional Population Boom

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • It is the year 1550 or later
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is catholic
    • State religion is counterreform
    • State religion is protestant
    • State religion is reformed
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Capital is on continent Europe
    • Capital is on continent Americas

Description

A sudden baby boom was not always a blessing at this time. Agricultural societies could not easily scale to handle larger populations in a given region. Population pressures often led to efforts at immigration overseas or movement to the city.

Actions

A. Grant Colonial Charter

  • +3 colonists

B. Deny Charter

  • +2500 population in a random province

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • It is the year 1550 or later
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is sunni
    • State religion is eastern_sunni
    • State religion is shia
    • State religion is eastern_shia
    • State religion is buddhist
    • State religion is jain
    • State religion is confucian
    • State religion is pagan

Actions

A. Deny Charter

  • +2500 population in the capital province

  • +3 colonists

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces
  • It is the year 1501 or later
  • Infrastructure tech is at 3 or higher

Description

States began to expand the number of doctors in the 16th century and also to regulate and supervise their training at universities. These regulations also covered midwives.

Actions

A. OK

  • +1500 population in a random province

96009104. Reining in the Merchant Princes

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • Mercantilism is at 2 or higher
  • Centralization is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Mercantilism is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Centralization is at 10 or higher
  • Aristocracy is at 2 or higher
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Capital is on continent Americas
    • Capital is on continent Europe
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is pagan

Description

The balance of power between the monarch, the nobles, and the merchant princes, was precarious. Sometimes the merchant princes got too powerful, and steps had to be taken to rein them in.

Actions

A. L'tat, c'est moi

  • Stability -2
  • Mercantilism +1
  • Centralization +1
  • Aristocracy -1

B. It's not worth the effort

  • Mercantilism -1
  • Centralization -1
  • Aristocracy +1

Back to top

96009105. Reining in the Nobles

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • Aristocracy is at 2 or higher
  • Centralization is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Aristocracy is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Centralization is at 10 or higher
  • Mercantilism is at 2 or higher
  • Centralization is at 5 or higher
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Capital is on continent Americas
    • Capital is on continent Europe
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is pagan

Description

The balance of power between the monarch, the nobles, and the merchant princes, was precarious. Sometimes the nobles got too powerful, and steps had to be taken to reassert the royal might.

A. L'tat, c'est moi

  • Stability -2
  • Mercantilism +1
  • Centralization +1
  • Aristocracy -1

  • Mercantilism -1
  • Centralization -1
  • Aristocracy +1

96000079. Releasing mercenaries

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at 1 or higher
  • Country is not at war
  • Capital is on continent Europe
  • The following must not occur:
    • It is the year 1650 or later

Description

In times of peace, to save money, European states would release some of its mercenaries. This form of desertion was always used to cull the older aged troops.

Actions

A. Release them

  • Lose 5000 troops in a random province
  • +100

B. Status quo

  • -20
  • Land tech investment: -200

92008001. Religious Turmoil

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • It is the year 1530 or later
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Capital is on continent Europe
    • Capital is on continent Asia
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is confucian

Description

After the Reformation, the European continent would have to live for several hundred years with religious differences causing rebellions and uprisings more or less frequently.

Actions

A. Crush the revolt

  • Create a religious revolt in a random province

B. Grant them limited autonomy

  • Stability -2
  • Innovativeness +1

C. Use this to eliminate some heathens

  • Stability -1
  • The same province converts to the state religion
  • Create a religious revolt in the same province
  • Create a religious revolt in the same province
  • Create a religious revolt in the same province
  • -5000 population in the same province
  • Innovativeness -1

96000121. Religious blessings

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Capital is on continent Europe
  • State religion is catholic
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 5 or higher
  • Badboy is at 3 or higher
  • Country has at least 3 missionaries
  • The following must not occur:
    • Event 102 - Council of Trent for all countries has already occurred

Description

Before the Reformation the Holy Roman Church had great influence in all western European realms. At nearly every court a priest or Jesuit was present - even in modern times a heritage of this is that the ambassador of the Vatican leads the diplomatic corps in most nations as he is the eldest diplomat present. With the Popes blessings and the work of the church's servants we can convince our neighbours that our recent conquests were justified.

Actions

A. Send the priests

  • -25
  • -3 missionaries
  • -2 badboy

B. Tax the populace more

  • +50
  • Global revolt risk -1 for 12 months
  • -3 missionaries

Back to top

  • +1 colonists

    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces

Demographic, economic and political pressure at home made way for sudden increases in the number of people looking for a better life in rich uncharted lands and businessmen in search of adventure and wealth in overseas trade.

Actions

A. OK

  • +3 colonists

Back to top

96000041. Saint Performs Miracle

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is catholic
    • State religion is counterreform
    • State religion is orthodox

Description

Some people were so devout in their religion that they set out to help the poor and heal the sick. They were often called saints for their acts and were sometimes even believed to perform miracles.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability +1
  • Global revolt risk -1 for 12 months

Back to top

90000050. Sale of Offices

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

The crown often resorted to short term cash grabs like the sale of government offices. These sales would bring in a lot of revenue but in the long haul more officials meant more tax revenue siphoned off before it reached the royal treasury.

Actions

A. Decline

  • -5 victory points

B. Accept

  • -1 base tax value in a random province
  • +100

Back to top

96000004. Scandal at the Court

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own

Description

Sometimes a scandal would erupt in the royal court and would upset a monarch to the point where most diplomatic activity would come to a standstill until things quieted down a bit.

Actions

A. Do nothing

  • Monarch's diplomatic skill -2 for 6 months
  • -10 relations with a random country

B. Toss some money around to cover things up

  • -25

C. Twist this to our advantage

  • Stability -1
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill -2 for 30 months
  • -45 relations with the same country
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against the same country for 12 months

Back to top

  • Monarch's diplomatic skill -2 for 60 months

91009094. Sufi Poets

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is sunni
    • State religion is eastern_sunni
  • Capital is on continent Asia
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces
  • Innovativeness is at 6 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Trade tech is at 10 or higher

Description

An esoteric and mystic branch of Islam, Sufism, flourished upon contact with the Hindus and continued to spread the name of Islam in a peaceful manner to the east. It emphasized synthesis of values, and was renowned for its poetry, including the retelling of Hindu stories. Muslim courts embracing Sufism became centers of learning and the arts.

Actions

A. Support Sufi Mystics

  • -50
  • Trade tech investment: +75
  • Innovativeness +1

B. Let them laze about elsewhere

  • -1 victory points

Back to top

90000070. Support for Dissidents Abroad

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Monarchs were contacted by a variety of dissidents from other states. These dissidents claimed to have vast supporters who just needed some cash - they were usually lying. Despite this, their claims excited many influential people at the court - particularly when religion entered the mix. Supporting these dissidents rarely accomplished anything other than antagonizing the other state but failure to support could create a bad impression at home.

Actions

A. Decline

  • Stability -1

B. Support

  • -25
  • -25 relations with a random country

Back to top

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • It is the year 1700 or later
  • The following must not occur:

    • State religion is protestant
    • State religion is reformed
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Capital is on continent Europe
    • Capital is on continent Americas

Description

Trading companies were often founded on highly speculative stocks. When they failed, large sums of wealth could be lost and faith in the goverment declined as well.

Actions

A. OK

  • -25
  • Trade tech investment: -250

96000099. Treacherous noble arrested

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Aristocracy is at 6 or higher

Description

A foolish, but wealthy, popular, and high-ranking, noble has been implicated in a treasonous plot. The plot had little chance of success and he pleads for forgiveness, but the evidence against him is strong. How shall we deal with this fool?

Actions

A. Hang him and confiscate his estate

  • Stability -3
  • Centralization +1
  • Aristocracy -2
  • +100
  • A random province revolts
  • Global revolt risk +2 for 12 months

B. Behead him and leave his estate to his heirs

  • Stability -2
  • Centralization +1
  • Aristocracy -1
  • The same province revolts
  • Global revolt risk +1 for 12 months

C. Show mercy - impose a fine and exile

  • Stability -1
  • Centralization -1
  • +25
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 60 months

Back to top

96010099. Treacherous noble arrested

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Aristocracy is at 8 or higher

Description

A foolish, but wealthy, popular, and high-ranking, noble has been implicated in a treasonous plot. The plot had little chance of success and he pleads for forgiveness, but the evidence against him is strong. How shall we deal with this fool?

Actions

A. Hang him and confiscate his estate

  • Stability -3
  • Centralization +1
  • Aristocracy -2
  • +100
  • A random province revolts
  • Global revolt risk +2 for 12 months

B. Behead him and leave his estate to his heirs

  • Stability -2
  • Centralization +1
  • Aristocracy -1
  • The same province revolts
  • Global revolt risk +1 for 12 months

C. Show mercy - impose a fine and exile

  • Stability -1
  • Centralization -1
  • +25
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 60 months

Back to top

96009064. Uncooperative Philosopher

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Innovativeness is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 10 or higher

Description

Many times men of ideas would posit ideas that ran counter to accept doctrine either from the monarch or the church. The state would normally try to get the thinker to recant his ideas and, failing that, would resort to imprisonment or execution. Men like Giordono Bruno, Thomas Moore and Galileo are classic examples of troublesome thinkers.

Actions

A. Imprison Thinker

  • Stability +1
  • Innovativeness -1

B. Allow to Remain Free

  • Stability -1
  • Innovativeness +1

Back to top

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human

  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 10 or higher
  • Badboy is at 40 or higher

  • Stability -2
  • Innovativeness +1

96000010. Unexpected Invention

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Innovativeness is at 2 or higher
  • Infrastructure tech is at 3 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is confucian
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is pagan
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Unexpected inventions sometimes led to immediate technical applications, and manufactories were built to exploit them.

Actions

A. OK

  • Gain random manufactory in a random province

All countries — Random

Conditions

    • Own
  • Serfdom is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Infrastructure tech is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Actions

A. Execute the Troublemakers

  • Infrastructure tech investment: -100

B. Abolish a Tax

  • Serfdom -1
  • -25

92008020. Unhappiness among the Clergy

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Stability is at -2 or higher
  • Innovativeness is at 2 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is confucian

Description

Conflict of opinion or interest over religious or secular matters between the ruler and the religious authorities often upset the clergy, which used its strong preaching power to influence the people of the realm.

Actions

A. Ignore their Demands

  • Stability -1

B. Agree to their Demands

  • Innovativeness -1

90009025. Unhappiness among the Merchants

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Conflict and protests over taxes corporations port duties navy requisitions trade and customs policies were quite frequent and often had counterproductive effects.

Actions

A. Refuse to change our position

  • -1 merchants
  • Trade tech investment: -100

B. Agree to some of their demands

  • -50
  • Mercantilism -1

C. Use this as an excuse to seize their assets!

  • Stability -1
  • Trade tech investment: -200
  • +50
  • -6 merchants
  • Mercantilism +1

90018025. Unhappiness among the Merchants

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by AI
  • Mercantilism is at 6 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Trade tech is at 10 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces

Description

Conflict and protests over taxes corporations port duties navy requisitions trade and customs policies were quite frequent and often had counterproductive effects.

Actions

A. Refuse to change our position

  • -1 merchants
  • Trade tech investment: -100

Back to top

91019025. Unhappiness among the Merchants

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • Mercantilism is at 6 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • Trade tech is at 10 or higher
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Conflict and protests over taxes corporations port duties navy requisitions trade and customs policies were quite frequent and often had counterproductive effects.

Actions

A. Refuse to change our position

  • -1 merchants
  • Trade tech investment: -200

B. Agree to some of their demands

  • -100
  • Mercantilism -1

C. Use this as an excuse to seize their assets!

  • Stability -1
  • Trade tech investment: -400
  • +100
  • -6 merchants
  • Mercantilism +1

Back to top

91000023. Unhappiness among the Peasantry

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Conflict and protests over taxes landlord cruelty expropriation serfdom and customs policies were quite frequent and resulted in discontent and even revolts.

Actions

A. Side with the Lords

  • Stability -1
  • A random province revolts

B. Side with the Peasants

  • Stability -2
  • Serfdom -1

C. Use This as an Excuse to Increase Taxes

  • Stability -4
  • Serfdom -1
  • +1 base tax value in a random province
  • The same province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • Global revolt risk +2 for 12 months
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 60 months

D. Pay Off Peasant Leaders

  • Stability -1
  • -25

Back to top

92000023. Unhappiness among the Peasantry

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

  • Stability -2
  • Serfdom -1

  • Stability -3
  • Serfdom -1

91010023. Unhappiness among the Peasantry

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Serfdom is at 6 or higher
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 9 non-colonial provinces

Description

Conflict and protests over taxes landlord cruelty expropriation serfdom and customs policies were quite frequent and resulted in discontent and even revolts.

Actions

A. OK

  • Stability -2
  • A random province revolts

Back to top

92000000. Unprovoked Revolt

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 30 non-colonial provinces

Description

Revolts were almost part of everyday life for the rulers all over Europe. High taxes noblemen cruelties as well as cultural and religious differencies caused unhappiness among the farmers and in the cities and in the most extreme cases this led to rebellions with sometimes long lasting and drastic effect.

Actions

A. OK

  • A random province revolts

Back to top

96000109. Volunteers for the war!

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is at war
  • Aristocracy is at 5 or higher

Description

During wartime sometimes the aristocracy or even the peasantry would rally to the cause of their King, although nationalism in it's present form was relatively unknown, a skillfull monarch could easily gain volunteers.

Actions

A. Volunteers are always welcome!

  • Gain 5 warships in a random province
  • +5000 cavalry in the same province

Back to top

96010109. Volunteers for the war!

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is at war
  • The following must not occur:
    • Aristocracy is at 5 or higher

Description

During wartime sometimes the aristocracy or even the peasantry would rally to the cause of their King, although nationalism in it's present form was relatively unknown, a skillfull monarch could easily gain volunteers.

Actions

A. Volunteers are always welcome!

  • Gain 10 galleys in a random province
  • +10000 infantry in the same province

Back to top

96009005. Wave of Obscurantism

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by human
  • The following must not occur:
    • Event 103 - Edict of Tolerance for all countries has already occurred
  • Capital is on continent Europe
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is Catholic
    • State religion is Counterreform
    • State religion is Protestant
    • State religion is Reformed

Description

As a typical response to different kinds of problems obscurantism was a frequent behavior in most nations at least until the Age of Enlightenment arose in the most advanced western nations of the European continent.

Actions

A. Do nothing

  • Global revolt risk +2 for 12 months
  • Serfdom +1

B. Give support to local efforts

  • -50
  • Global revolt risk +1 for 12 months

C. React harshly

  • Stability +1
  • -2 missionaries
  • Global revolt risk +5 for 12 months
  • A random province revolts
  • The same province revolts
  • Innovativeness +1

D. Encourage it

  • Stability -1
  • +2 missionaries
  • Innovativeness -1

Back to top

96008005. Wave of Obscurantism

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • Country is controlled by AI
  • The following must not occur:
    • Event 103 - Edict of Tolerance for all countries has already occurred
  • Capital is on continent Europe
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • State religion is Catholic
    • State religion is Counterreform
    • State religion is Protestant
    • State religion is Reformed

Description

As a typical response to different kinds of problems obscurantism was a frequent behavior in most nations at least until the Age of Enlightenment arose in the most advanced western nations of the European continent.

Actions

A. Do nothing

  • Global revolt risk +2 for 12 months
  • Serfdom +1

B. Give support to local efforts

  • -50
  • Global revolt risk +1 for 12 months

96000098. Zealous Missionary

All countries — Random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Own
  • The following must not occur:
    • Country has at least 4 non-colonial provinces
  • The following must not occur:
    • Innovativeness is at 6 or higher
  • The following must not occur:
    • State religion is confucian

Description

Extremely religiously intolerant rulers always relied on force and staunch fanatics to wipe any presence of heresy in their realm.

Actions

A. Great!

  • +1 missionaries
